content:
* Title should be related to COC task requirement

* Missing FASTEST mode

* I think -1 should not be the only negative number to be expected from [[M]] && [[N]]

Goal
* I've formatted "-1" as a {{constant}}.
* I've amended the variable name "n" to "N" for consistency.

Input
* I've completely rewritten this section.

Output
* I've added "or {{-1}}" to the description.
does anyone know a shorter solution than 126 characters in ruby? i tried it in bash but couldn't get less than something like 150 characters
The negative m cases violate the published constraints, and the -1 -1 validator case does so twice.

Just had this puzzle in a clash, somehow the statement didnt actually have the last pert that explains what an ackermann function is. It is also possible to pass all of the tests and fail at least 1 or 2 validators, which in a clash should not happen

I just corrected some spelling mistakes, and swapped M and N in the constraints.
Speaking of constraints, the big problem with this clash is that the inputs don't respect the constraints...  I should be corrected.

I was able to pass the last two validators while failing the corresponding tests (using ruby with turn count to trip over safety net). This is definitely not good because the validators should check the same thing as their tests.
I think there is a problem in the input order.
Statement of the CoC must be improved. I don't know what is Ackermann function and I must say that I have difficulties to understand how it works by reading the statement.

I've adjusted the constraints to include the -1 possibility, and clarified that the output should be -1 in those cases.  I removed the text "m=3 is possible to compute, but won't be computed" (or words to that effect) because it was confusing and also redundant with the m < 3 constraint.
I got 91 in ruby, without using any tricks with just pure `gets`, use a lambda may help
